title: Lecture: Roberta Bernstein on Jasper Johns
hero_caption: <p>Jasper Johns. <em>Figure 4</em>, 1959. Gift of Edlis|Neeson Collection. © Jasper Johns / Licensed by VAGA, New York, NY.</p>
description:
Roberta Bernstein, art historian and author of the Catalog Raisonné of the Paintings and Sculpture of Jasper Johns, reviews the contemporary artist's symbolic work.

*Museum admission is free for Illinois residents every Thursday, 5:00–8:00—including during this event.

Sponsored by the Frank J. Mooney Memorial Fund

To request an accessibility accommodation for an Art Institute program, please call (312) 443-3680 or send an e-mail to access@artic.edu as far in advance as possible.
